I would also like to confirm whether the telemetry mode you used when the throttle motor was damaged was continuous telemetry. On Sat, Sep 6, 2025, 8:03 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi jim skeoch,    We’re truly sorry to hear about the issues you’ve experienced with the VAM motor.     To clarify, the VAM is a rotary motor, and when used for vibration effects like ABS or traction control, it operates in a start-stop pattern — which it’s not inherently designed for. Over time, this type of operation can cause premature wear or failure. While VAM is a more affordable entry-level option and remains popular, under the same quality control standards, we’ve found that VAM Pro performs far better with extremely low failure rates and delivers significantly stronger, more reliable force feedback.     Because of this, we are currently evaluating whether to discontinue the VAM and keep only the VAM Pro, similar to Simagic’s product strategy.     If you’d like, we’d be happy to offer you a refund for the VAM, so you can place a new order for the VAM Pro. It’s designed to handle these vibration effects much better, and in our tests and customer feedback, it even outperforms Simagic’s alternatives in terms of strength, responsiveness, and durability.     We sincerely hope you’ll give our upgraded version a chance. If you decide to proceed, please let us know — we’ll be glad to assist with a special discount or dedicated support.
